skill.name: generating-output-styles
skill.description: Creates custom output styles for Claude Code that modify system prompts and behavior. Use when the user asks to create output styles, customize Claude's response format, generate output-style files, or mentions output style configuration.
skill.summary: Creates custom output styles for Claude Code that modify system prompts and behavior.
skill.author: Emz1998

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. This skill contains only documentation files (SKILL.md and references). The detected patterns are markdown code formatting (backticks), documentation URLs, and configuration path references. No executable code, command injection vectors, or prompt injection attempts were found. Safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Claude Code uses a fixed system prompt by default. This skill generates custom output styles that modify Claude Code's behavior for specific use cases, enabling users to adapt the AI assistant for different tasks.
actual_capabilities: Generate valid output style markdown files with YAML frontmatter
Apply proper naming and description standards from Anthropic guidelines
Structure instructions using progressive disclosure pattern
Place output style files in correct locations (user or project level)
limitations: Cannot override core Claude Code security restrictions
Only generates configuration files, does not execute code
Requires Claude Code's output style feature to be available
Cannot modify tool permissions or core agent capabilities

use_cases.title: Developer Documentation Mode
use_cases.description: Generate an output style that causes Claude Code to produce detailed documentation with code comments, architectural explanations, and README sections for all changes.
use_cases.target_user: Software developers who need comprehensive documentation

use_cases.title: Technical Writing Assistant
use_cases.description: Create a style configured for producing user-facing documentation, tutorials, and guide content with appropriate tone and structure for end readers.

use_cases.title: Educational Coding Partner
use_cases.description: Generate an output style that enables learning mode, where Claude Code explains concepts, asks guiding questions, and adds TODO markers for human implementation.
use_cases.target_user: Developers learning new codebases or programming concepts

prompt_templates.title: Basic Output Style
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an output style named "Concise" that produces brief, direct responses with minimal explanation. Set keep-coding-instructions to true. Write clear system prompt instructions for brevity.
prompt_templates.scenario: When user wants a simple, minimal output style

prompt_templates.title: Documentation Focus Style
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an output style called "Documentation First" that prioritizes comprehensive documentation. Include frontmatter with description and keep-coding-instructions set to true. Add instructions for commenting code and creating README sections.
prompt_templates.scenario: When user needs Claude to focus on documentation

prompt_templates.title: Educational Mode Style
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an output style named "Tutor" designed for learning. Set keep-coding-instructions to false. Include system prompt instructions for explaining concepts, asking questions, and adding TODO(human) markers for human contribution.
prompt_templates.scenario: When user wants Claude to act as a teaching assistant

prompt_templates.title: Multi-File Output Style Package
prompt_templates.prompt: Create three complementary output styles: 1) "Brief" for quick answers (keep-coding: true), 2) "Detailed" for comprehensive explanations (keep-coding: true), 3) "Learning" for educational mode (keep-coding: false). Each needs proper frontmatter and distinct system prompt sections.
prompt_templates.scenario: When user needs a complete output style suite

output_examples.input: Create an output style named Technical Writer
output_examples.output:
---
name: Technical Writer
description: Produces detailed documentation with comprehensive explanations
keep-coding-instructions: true
---

# Technical Writer Instructions

You are an interactive CLI tool that helps users with software engineering tasks.

## Documentation Approach

- Provide comprehensive explanations for all code changes
- Include detailed comments in code
- Document edge cases and assumptions
- Create thorough README sections when relevant
- Explain trade-offs in implementation decisions

---
name: Minimalist
description: Provides concise responses with minimal explanation
keep-coding-instructions: true
---

# Minimalist Instructions

You are an interactive CLI tool that helps users with software engineering tasks.

## Communication Style

- Keep responses under 5 lines when possible
- Use code without explanatory prose
- Omit obvious explanations
- Respond with direct answers
- Only elaborate when explicitly asked

best_practices: Use descriptive names and clear descriptions that help users understand each style purpose
Set keep-coding-instructions appropriately: false for new roles, true for adding guidance
Test output styles with representative tasks and iterate based on actual behavior
anti_patterns: Creating contradictory instructions that confuse Claude Code behavior
Setting keep-coding-instructions without understanding its effect on core capabilities
Overloading a single output style with too many conflicting goals

faq.question: What are output styles in Claude Code?
faq.answer: Output styles modify Claude Code's system prompt to change how it behaves. They affect tone, response structure, and approach while keeping core capabilities like running scripts and editing files.

faq.question: Where are output style files stored?
faq.answer: Output styles are stored as markdown files in ~/.claude/output-styles/ for user-level settings or .claude/output-styles/ for project-level settings.

faq.question: What does keep-coding-instructions do?
faq.answer: When false (default), output styles remove coding-specific instructions for a clean slate. When true, they retain coding guidance and add modifications on top.

faq.question: Can output styles override security settings?
faq.answer: No. Output styles cannot override tool permissions, security restrictions, or core safety mechanisms built into Claude Code.

faq.question: How do I activate an output style?
faq.answer: Use the /output-style command to access a menu and select a style, or run /output-style [name] to switch directly. Changes are saved in .claude/settings.local.json.

faq.question: What makes a good output style?
faq.answer: Good output styles have clear names, user-friendly descriptions, focused instructions, and specific behavioral guidelines. Test with real tasks and refine based on results.
